MajorClaims.MC1: it is the responsibility of these disadvantaged citizens, rather than the government, to help them out
MajorClaims.MC2: direct financial support may not be a wise option and people should rely on themselves to get out of the adversity

Claims.C1: the government should provide help for the disadvantaged people
Claims.C2: Government money should be spent on publicly beneficial programs only
Claims.C3: to survive in this competitive world, one has to work hard and equip themselves well
Claims.C4: this does not mean we should leave alone those who do need assistance

Premises.P1: Tax revenue is collected from those who works
Premises.P2: Spending them on helping those not make contribution to society would not sound fair to tax payers
Premises.P3: there are other pressing demands on the government expenditure, such as health care service and education
Premises.P4: addressing unemployment should have low priority
Premises.P5: If they could get free financial help from the government, they might end up with out any motivation to work at all
Premises.P6: it is beneficial to the society as a whole when the jobless can make contribution again
Premises.P7: They are already in reverse circumstances and it would be rather difficult for them to overcome the difficulties without external support
Premises.P8: the government ought to set up free vocational trainings or to provide interest-free bank loans for them, so that they can have the chance to get back to work
